Kup:

"I'm not Giving up Nightlight or Rodimus, neither Windlord, whose is =
another MIA... YES, Tucson!! Not only Rodimus and nightlight are held capti=
ve for Hydras"replied Kup"Windlord is another captive that is held and poss=
ibly reprograming by Hydras , or only a matrix-bearer and his wife counts? =
He was captured trying to rescue him, Talon reported that; That's why I cam=
e here with Elita; I cant allow that nothing happens her... Windlord knew t=
he location of Elita and i didnt like to take chances... I'm not close to i=
nnovation, Tucson, but  If we are willing to rescue them, we have to do it =
in a way that avoid another MIA, and most important: Keep Elita safe."


Fr=
om: Sandy 
Sent: Monday, March 15, 2010 11:50 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com=
 
Subject: Re: Back to the Ark


  
Tucson narrows his eyes. He turns sharp=
ly to Kup.

"Then all the more reason to return the favor. Kup, when Rodimu=
s was in his right mind, you did not give up on his beliefs. I respect you,=
 I always will, but when it came to me trying to suggest something out of t=
he box, you called it wrecklessness and something that shouldn't be attempt=
ed. Truth is, Hydras and Perceptor are onto our old school method of doing =
things, truth is, IT'S TIME TO THINK OUTSIDE THE PROVERBIAL BOX!"

He had n=
ever yelled at Kup, and most certainly did not mean it, but something was b=
uilding inside him. Something he had not shown even to Kup in fear that he =
may disrespect his old friend. But things were different, and in order to f=
ight innovation one must embrace it. He was indeed ready to embrace innovat=
ion. He paces vigorously as the energon flows into his system.

" Nothing i=
s impossible Kup, nothing. I'm most certainly not giving up on Rodimus or N=
ightlight. And I'm not going to let Hydras get away with this! It's time we=
 showed them that the Autobots are not extinct yet! IT'S TIME TO TRANSFORM =
AND ROLL OUT!" 

His voice at the last statement, mirrors that of old Optim=
us Prime, who always said those words when it was time to go into battle.

=
All the time, his outburst occurs right beside the fallen body of his old l=
eader.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, <airly2002@...> wrote:
>
> Kup:
> 
>=
 Kup took an Sleepy Elita and said softly "I'm close enought to Rodimus to =
assure that he wouldnt be easy to reprogram as Predacon in normal circuntan=
ces, but when the matrix was captured... It's hard to explain... Nightlight=
 jsut was a bait... it isnt the frist time that hydras capture her.... When=
 Elita was a baby, Hydras snatched her from inside the base... a maximal di=
ed tried to rescue her but we failed... she was reprogramed then and I shou=
ld admit it, Perceptor did an excellent job"said with bitterness Kup"She al=
most died when we reprogramed her back to her maximal original program"and =
looking to elita he added "After the matrix were captured, she again disapp=
eared this time Hydras used a posed maximal to lure her out our sight... We=
 knew that she had disapeared cause she always gives Elita her good night k=
iss, she never have missed it... Rodimus ran outside the base looking for h=
er and he disappeared too; I guess that Hydras took advantage of Rodimus's =
emotional status to break him... We had just loose the battle and we didnt =
pay attention when they have vanished"
> 
> Kup Shook his head "I told you,=
 Tucson, once we get them out side the BlackFortress wotn be easy to reprog=
ram them back to Maximal... I almost Willing to force Perceptor to tell us =
what kind of locks he had done even it that mean to forget all Maximals and=
 Autobots protocols"
> 
> 
> 
> From: Sandy 
> Sent: Monday, March 15, 2010=
 9:18 PM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> Subject: Re: Back to the Ark
> 
> =

> 
> Tucson nodds and opens an energy port leading directly into his left =
wrist. 
> 
> "Yes, that sounds good Lord Elder. Here, this will make it eas=
y to administer the energon." 
> 
> He takes a seat near everyone but espec=
ially near Elita. Rodimus and Nightlight were already taken from her and he=
 was not about to let her fall into the same fate. Her sadness to him is a =
torture he felt she did not deserve. She had done nothing to no one and in =
return was suffering a great deal. This angers him yet he tries desperately=
 to hold back his elevating temper. He cracks his knuckles to try and calm =
himself down although at this point, he didn't know if he could ever calm d=
own.
> 
> "As if the battle between us and Unicron wasn't enough. Now Hydra=
s, Cyclonus and Scourge have to go on a meaningless power trip and torment =
innocent Autobots and Maximals without rime or reason. I know if Rodimus we=
re in his right mind, he would not tolerate it, and certainly not Optimus. =
As far as I heard from what I learned while at the fortress, Cyclonus is fe=
eding off the power of the Matrix which is in Rodimus's body. That's what's=
 making him stronger. Well, guess what? I'm prepared to cut that umbilcal c=
ord no matter how much it damages my own spark. I learned something about s=
elf worth. What am I worth? How can I be worth something when there are liv=
es just starting out there that are more precious than my own? And how can =
I say I'm worth something when we have young aspiring Autobots and Maximals=
 just starting their careers as soldiers? They have their whole lives ahead=
 of them, and by Primus I'm prepared to give back what's been taken from th=
em, THEIR FREEDOM!"
>
